title: What causes opioid addiction, and why is it so tough to combat? - Mike Davis

multiple-choice.question: What ancient civilization is believed to have used opium for its medicinal properties?

What is the primary reason why opioids are highly addictive?

options.label: A
options.text: They alter the brain's chemistry to produce feelings of pleasure

options.label: B
options.text: They suppress the release of noradrenaline, leading to dependence

options.label: C
options.text: They have a high potential for overdose

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of dopamine in the release of opioid receptors?

options.label: A
options.text: It suppresses the release of dopamine

options.label: B
options.text: It triggers the release of dopamine, linked to feelings of pleasure

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on dopamine release

options.label: D
options.text: It increases the sensitivity of dopamine receptors

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: A therapeutic dose suppresses the release of dopamine, while a higher dose triggers it

options.label: D
options.text: A therapeutic dose has no effect on noradrenaline release, while a higher dose decreases it

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason why the body becomes dependent on opioids to maintain a new balance after long-term use?

options.label: A
options.text: It increases the sensitivity of opioid receptors

options.label: B
options.text: It decreases the sensitivity of opioid receptors

options.label: C
options.text: It increases the number of noradrenaline receptors

options.label: D
options.text: It decreases the number of noradrenaline receptors

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason why opioid withdrawal can be debilitating?

options.label: A
options.text: It can cause muscle aches and stomach pains

options.label: B
options.text: It can cause fever and vomiting

options.label: C
options.text: It can disrupt the balance of noradrenaline in the body

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary difference between opioid maintenance programs and other treatment options?

options.label: A
options.text: Opioid maintenance programs use medication to eliminate opioid abuse

options.label: B
options.text: Opioid maintenance programs use behavior therapy to eliminate opioid abuse

options.label: C
options.text: Opioid maintenance programs avoid withdrawal symptoms with drugs that bind to opioid receptors

options.label: D
options.text: Opioid maintenance programs have a longer waiting list than other treatment options

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason why buprenorphine is scarce?

options.label: B
options.text: It requires a special waiver to prescribe

options.label: C
options.text: It has a high potential for overdose

options.label: D
options.text: It is not effective in treating opioid addiction

multiple-choice.question: What is a society?

options.text: A large group of people who share the same laws, rights, and resources.

options.label: C
options.text: A group of people who work together in the same place.

options.label: D
options.text: A group of people who believe in the same thing.

options.label: D
options.text: A neighborhood, a community of people who share the same work, or a group of people who believe in the same thing.

options.label: C
options.text: Whether they share the same laws, rights, and resources.

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Which is better: Soap or hand sanitizer? - Alex Rosenthal and Pall Thordarson

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason why viruses can infect us when we touch our face?

options.label: A
options.text: Because our hands are smooth and provide a good surface for viruses to stick to.

options.label: B
options.text: Because our hands have peaks and valleys, folds and rifts, which provide hiding places for viruses.

options.label: C
options.text: Because our hands are not washed regularly, allowing viruses to attach to them.

options.label: D
options.text: Because our hands are exposed to the environment, making them susceptible to viral infection.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the main difference between soap and hand sanitizer in terms of how they interact with the coronavirus?

options.label: A
options.text: Soap is more effective at killing the virus, while hand sanitizer is less effective.

options.label: B
options.text: Soap works like a crowbar to pry apart the virus's membrane, while hand sanitizer works like an earthquake to destabilize it.

options.label: C
options.text: Soap is more convenient to use, while hand sanitizer is more effective at killing the virus.

options.label: D
options.text: Soap is less effective at killing the virus, while hand sanitizer is more effective.

options.label: A
options.text: Because soap and water are more effective at killing the virus than hand sanitizer.

options.label: B
options.text: Because soap and water need to get everywhere, including your palms, fingertips, the outsides of your hands, and between your fingers, to protect you properly.

options.label: C
options.text: Because hand sanitizer is more convenient to use and can be used on the go.

options.label: D
options.text: Because soap and water are more expensive than hand sanitizer.

options.text: The hydrophobic effect is a property of the coronavirus's membrane that makes it resistant to soap and water.

options.label: B
options.text: The hydrophobic effect is a property of soap and hand sanitizer that makes them effective at killing the virus.

options.label: C
options.text: The hydrophobic effect is a property of water that makes it difficult for the coronavirus to attach to it.

options.label: D
options.text: The hydrophobic effect is a property of the coronavirus's membrane that makes it susceptible to soap and water.

options.label: A
options.text: Soap is more effective at killing the virus, while hand sanitizer is less effective.

options.label: B
options.text: Soap works like a crowbar to pry apart the virus's membrane, while hand sanitizer works like an earthquake to destabilize it.

options.label: C
options.text: Soap is more convenient to use, while hand sanitizer is more effective at killing the virus.

options.label: D
options.text: Soap and hand sanitizer both work by destabilizing the virus's spike proteins.

options.label: A
options.text: Because soap and water are more effective at killing the virus than hand sanitizer.

options.label: B
options.text: Because soap and water need to get everywhere, including your palms, fingertips, the outsides of your hands, and between your fingers, to protect you properly.

options.label: C
options.text: Because hand sanitizer is more convenient to use and can be used on the go.

options.text: Because soap and water are more expensive than hand sanitizer.

options.label: D

options.text: Because hand sanitizer works like an earthquake to destabilize the virus's membrane.

options.label: B
